subject: Public Speaking
title: Cortisol and the Stress Cascade
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cortisol and the Stress Cascade.

hook.text: Minutes before a speech, your body starts producing cortisol. It's the same hormone released during combat.

buildup.text: Cortisol sharpens some senses but impairs memory retrieval. That's why you can't remember your opening line.

twist.text: Moderate cortisol actually improves performance. Too much destroys it. The dose makes the poison.

climax.text: The goal isn't zero stress. It's the right amount â€” enough to sharpen you without shutting you down.

punchline.text: A little fear helps. A lot of fear freezes.

quiz.question: How does cortisol affect speaking performance?
options: Moderate levels help, but too much impairs memory
